chat_history.content:
The four most expensive elements are:

1. Rhodium: $147,000 per kilogram
2. Iridium: $55,500 - $56,200 per kilogram
3. Platinum: $27,800 per kilogram
4. Gold: $44,800 per kilogram

These elements are known for their high value and unique properties.

chat_history.content:
- Platinum was discovered by William Hyde Wollaston in 1804.
- Rhodium was discovered by William Hyde Wollaston in 1804.
- Gold has been known since ancient times and its discovery date is not specific.
- Palladium was discovered by William Hyde Wollaston in 1802.

chat_history.content:
Here are the four most expensive elements and the years they were discovered:

1. **Rhodium**: $147,000 per kilogram
   - Discovered in 1804 by William Hyde Wollaston

2. **Iridium**: $55,500 - $56,200 per kilogram
   - Discovered in 1803 by Smithson Tennant

3. **Platinum**: $27,800 per kilogram
   - Discovered in 1804 by William Hyde Wollaston

4. **Gold**: $44,800 per kilogram
   - Known since ancient times; specific discovery date is not available

Note: The information provided about Palladium was not relevant to the query.

Per-kilogram prices of some synthetic radioisotopes range to trillions of dollars. While the difficulty of obtaining macroscopic samples of synthetic elements in part explains their high value, there has been interest in converting base metals to gold (Chrysopoeia) since ancient times, but only deeper understanding of nuclear physics has allowed the actual production of a tiny amount of gold from other elements for research purposes as demonstrated by Glenn Seaborg.[1][2] However, both this and other routes of synthesis of precious metals via nuclear reactions is orders of magnitude removed from economic viability.

chat_history.content:
The four most expensive elements are:

1. Rhodium: $147,000 per kilogram
2. Iridium: $55,500 - $56,200 per kilogram
3. Platinum: $27,800 per kilogram
4. Gold: $44,800 per kilogram

These elements are known for their high value and unique properties.

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

For decades, the rare element had only minor applications; for example, by the turn of the century, rhodium-containing thermocouples were used to measure temperatures up to 1800 °C.[17][18] They have exceptionally good stability in the temperature range of 1300 to 1800 °C.[19]


The first major application was electroplating for decorative uses and as corrosion-resistant coating.[20] The introduction of the three-way catalytic converter by Volvo in 1976 increased the demand for rhodium. The previous catalytic converters used platinum or palladium, while the three-way catalytic converter used rhodium to reduce the amount of NOx in the exhaust.[21][22][23]

This 5s0 configuration, unique in period 5, makes palladium the heaviest element having only *one* incomplete electron shell, with all shells above it empty.


Palladium has the appearance of a soft silver-white metal that resembles platinum. It is the least dense and has the lowest melting point of the platinum group metals. It is soft and ductile when annealed and is greatly increased in strength and hardness when cold-worked. Palladium dissolves slowly in concentrated nitric acid, in hot, concentrated sulfuric acid, and when finely ground, in hydrochloric acid.[8] It dissolves readily at room temperature in aqua regia.

chat_history.content:
- Platinum was discovered by William Hyde Wollaston in 1804.
- Rhodium was discovered by William Hyde Wollaston in 1804.
- Gold has been known since ancient times and its discovery date is not specific.
- Palladium was discovered by William Hyde Wollaston in 1802.

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
